ApplicationOperations

ApplicationOperations

ApplicationOperations
NOTE: An instance of this class is automatically created for an
instance of the BatchManagementClient.
Initializes a new instance of the ApplicationOperations class.

Constructor

new ApplicationOperations(client)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
client BatchManagementClient

Reference to the service client.
Source:
  • operations/applicationOperations.js, line 28

Methods

activateApplicationPackage(resourceGroupName, accountName, id, version, format, optionsopt, callback) → {function}

Activates the specified application package.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
resourceGroupName string

The name of the resource group that
contains the Batch account.
accountName string

The name of the Batch account.
id string

The id of the application.
version string

The version of the application to activate.
format string

The format of the application package binary file.
options object <optional>

Optional Parameters.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
customHeaders object <optional>

Headers that will be added to the
request
callback function

callback(err, result, request, response)

                 {Error}  err        - The Error object if an error occurred, null otherwise.

                 {null} [result]   - The deserialized result object.

                 {object} [request]  - The HTTP Request object if an error did not occur.

                 {stream} [response] - The HTTP Response stream if an error did not occur.

updateApplication(resourceGroupName, accountName, applicationId, parameters, optionsopt, callback) → {function}

Updates settings for the specified application.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
resourceGroupName string

The name of the resource group that
contains the Batch account.
accountName string

The name of the Batch account.
applicationId string

The id of the application.
parameters object

The parameters for the request.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
allowUpdates boolean <optional>

A value indicating whether
packages within the application may be overwritten using the same version
string.
defaultVersion string <optional>

Gets or sets which package to
use if a client requests the application but does not specify a version.
displayName string <optional>

The display name for the
application.
options object <optional>

Optional Parameters.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
customHeaders object <optional>

Headers that will be added to the
request
callback function
